alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, LIBERTY, BULLOCH, CANDLER, EFFINGHAM, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 324 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Register to 10 miles southwest of Mendes, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Reidsville, Glennville, Claxton, Pembroke, Brooklet, Hagan, Daisy, and Bellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
